item.title: Closed-door espionage trial of U.S. journalist kicks off in Russia
item.dc:creator: Francesca Ebel
item.description: Evan Gershkovich, who the U.S. says is wrongfully detained, was arrested on a reporting trip over a year ago in Russia and faces 20 years in prison if convicted.

item.title: Australia welcomes Julian Assange home amid warnings about press freedom
item.dc:creator: Michael E. Miller
item.description: There was broad bipartisan support at home for Assange’s release, but some politicians also noted that the press freedom has worsened in recent years.

item.title: Iran is picking a new president. Here’s what to know.
item.dc:creator: Anika Seth
item.description: Six men are running for president in Friday’s vote. Only one is considered a reformist.

item.title: Julian Assange pleads guilty to espionage charge, ending years of legal deadlock
item.dc:creator: Kelly Kasulis Cho, Ben Brasch, Rachel Pannett, Jonathan Edwards
item.description: The WikiLeaks founder was sentenced to time served and left a U.S. court in the Northern Mariana Islands a free man, en route for his native Australia.

item.title: The joy and rage over Assange’s release
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: Assange’s life and work remain the source of much febrile debate, across the political spectrum and around the world.

item.title: Half-million Gazans face ‘catastrophic’ hunger levels, U.N.-backed report says
item.dc:creator: Louisa Loveluck, Jennifer Hassan, Sarah Dadouch, Karen DeYoung
item.description: A flood of aid in the spring averted earlier famine warnings, but the aid operation has all but collapsed since Israel’s offensive in Rafah, the report said.

item.title: U.N.-approved, Kenya-led security force finally arrives in Haiti
item.dc:creator: Widlore Mérancourt, Amanda Coletta
item.description: The United States has recruited countries and led funding and logistics for the mission, but President Biden says he won’t send U.S. forces.

item.title: 5 killed as Kenyan police crack down on tax protests; Parliament set afire
item.dc:creator: Rael Ombuor
item.description: Amnesty Kenya said 31 people were injured, including 13 hit by live bullets. The five people killed had been treating the injured, the group said.

item.title: U.S. and Philippines seek to de-escalate after sea skirmish with China
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Tan, Ellen Nakashima
item.description: Chinese coast guard vessels have become more aggressive in blocking access to the contested Second Thomas Shoal.

item.title: Israeli Supreme Court rules ultra-Orthodox must serve in the military
item.dc:creator: Shira Rubin, Claire Parker, Lior Soroka
item.description: The decision could result in ultra-Orthodox lawmakers pulling out of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s coalition and collapsing it.

item.title: International Court issues warrants for top Russian military officials
item.dc:creator: Robyn Dixon, Francesca Ebel, Isabelle Khurshudyan
item.description: The warrants say Sergei Shoigu, the former defense minister, and Valery Gerasimov, army chief of staff, were responsible for the war crimes by targeting civilian infrastructure.

item.title: Microsoft broke antitrust rules by bundling Teams, E.U. says
item.dc:creator: Cat Zakrzewski, Aaron Gregg
item.description: It’s the second major action in as many days by the European Commission against a Big Tech company.

item.title: Julian Assange’s plea deal sparks global celebration, condemnation
item.dc:creator: Andrew Jeong, Adela Suliman, Dan Rosenzweig-Ziff
item.description: Reactions were divided as WikiLeaks’ Julian Assange heads to a U.S. Pacific territory to cement a plea deal that could soon set him free.

item.title: Even among world leaders, Biden and Trump are old
item.dc:creator: Ruby Mellen, Kevin Crowe, Artur Galocha
item.description: The next U.S. president, whether it’s Biden or Trump, will be at least 15 years older than the median for global leaders. Here’s how the ages of world leaders compare.

item.title: Count Binface challenges U.K. Prime Minister Rishi Sunak for Parliament seat
item.dc:creator: Karla Adam
item.description: A satirical recurring candidate is tapping into a deep sense of distrust in the British electorate.

item.title: For this U.S. airman, the Gaza war hit too close to home
item.dc:creator: Alex Horton
item.description: Mohammed Abu Hashem ended a 22-year Air Force career after his aunt was killed in an Israeli strike. “I can’t be part of the system that enabled this,” he says.

item.title: What to know about WikiLeaks’ Julian Assange and the deal set to free him
item.dc:creator: Frances Vinall
item.description: Assange is set to plead guilty to violating the Espionage Act at a U.S. court in the Northern Mariana Islands in exchange for his freedom. Here’s a refresher.

item.title: This art museum has a new home for its Picassos: The women’s bathroom
item.dc:creator: Rachel Pannett
item.description: A court ruled that the Museum of Old and New Art in Australia must admit men to a women-only lounge. So it moved some of its art to a ladies’ restroom.

item.title: The long saga of WikiLeaks’ Julian Assange may finally be over
item.dc:creator: William Booth
item.description: The sprawling drama involved hacking and leaking, flight and imprisonment, and the governments of the U.S., Britain, Sweden, Ecuador and Australia.

item.title: Timeline: Key moments for WikiLeaks and Julian Assange
item.dc:creator: Mikhail Klimentov
item.description: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange has reached a plea deal with the United States, probably ending the whistleblower’s lengthy legal saga.

item.title: O Canada! Is this the year the Stanley Cup drought ends?
item.dc:creator: Matt Bonesteel
item.description: The Edmonton Oilers are looking to become the first Canadian NHL team to hoist the Stanley Cup since 1993.

item.title: Netanyahu dismisses cease-fire proposal, angering hostage families
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Hassan, Rachel Pannett, Sammy Westfall
item.description: European foreign ministers are expressing concern about Israeli leader Benjamin Netanyahu’s apparent rejection of the proposal and mounting hostilities at the Lebanese border.

item.title: Princess Anne hospitalized with concussion after apparent horse incident
item.dc:creator: Karla Adam
item.description: According to a palace source, the medical team concluded that Anne’s injuries were consistent with those delivered by a horse’s head or legs. She is expected to recover.

item.title: After attack in Dagestan, Russian officials minimize Islamic State claim
item.dc:creator: Francesca Ebel, Robyn Dixon
item.description: Some Russian officials blamed Ukraine and the United States for a terrorist attack in the predominantly Muslim region of Dagestan despite the region’s long legacy of Islamist violence.

item.title: Travis Kelce carries Taylor Swift across stage, sending fans into frenzy
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Ma
item.description: Taylor Swift’s boyfriend, NFL star Travis Kelce, joined her on stage during a surprise Eras Tour appearance at London’s Wembley Stadium.
